SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description1Txt: GLOBAL DEVELOPMENT - IN-COUNTRY POLIO ERADICATION PROGRAMS; CONVENE GRANTEES TO PROMOTE COLLABORATION, IMPROVE PROGRAMS & STRENGTHEN THE GRANTEE NETWORK; SUPPLY CHAIN IMPROVEMENT STUDIES IN MULTIPLE COUNTRIES; ASSIST ORGANIZATIONS IN DEVELOPING INNOVATIVE FINANCING MECHANISMS & PRICING STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE GLOBAL ACCESS TO VACCINES, ESSENTIAL MEDICINES AND DIAGNOSITCS AND FAMILY HEALTH PRODUCTS; SUPPORT GRANTEES IN CREATING PLANS FOR INTRODUCING HEALTH CARE & VACCINATION PROGRAMS & FOR RESPONDING TO WIDESPREAD HEALTH CRISES & PANDEMICS; ASSIST IN STRENTHENING PRIMARY HEALTHCARE SYSTEMS; IMPROVE NUTRUTIONAL FOODS AND INTERVENTIONS; POLIO GPS TRACKING AND ANALYSIS; STRATEGIC PROJECT MANAGEMENT; STRATEGY SUPPORT; EVALUATION, COMMUNICATION AND ADVOCACY SUPPORT.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description2Txt: GLOBAL HEALTH - DISCOVERY, DEVELOPMENT, AND DELIVERY OF HIGH IMPACT GLOBAL HEALTH INTERVENTIONS. ENGAGE WITH NON-PROFIT, PUBLIC, AND COMMERCIAL PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY NOVEL PLATFORMS, PROCESSES, AND TECHNIQUES THAT ACCELERATE THE TIMELINE, REDUCE COST, AND REDUCE RISK FOR INTRODUCTION OF NEW AND AFFORDABLE VACCINES, MEDICINES, DIAGNOSTICS, AND DEVICES FOR DISEASES OF HIGH BURDEN IN THE DEVELOPING WORLD. ADVISE GLOBAL HEALTH GRANTEES IN DEVELOPING IMPACTFUL ADVOCACY AND COMMUNICATIONS STRATEGIES. CONVENE GLOBAL HEALTH GRANTEES TO SHARE RESEARCH FINDINGS, INNOVATIONS, AND BEST PRACTICES IN NUMEROUS AREAS OF GLOBAL HEALTH AND MEDICINE.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description3Txt: GLOBAL GROWTH & OPPORTUNITY - DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT NEW TECHNOLOGIES THAT WILL INCREASE THE EFFICIENCY, EFFICACY, & AFFORDABILITY OF EMPTYING PIT LATRINES & SEPTIC TANKS; CONVENE GRANTEES TO PROMOTE COLLABORATION, IMPROVE PROGRAMS & STRENGTHEN THE GRANTEE NETWORK; SUPPORT DISCOVERY STUDIES AND DEVELOPMENT PLANS ON AGRICULTURAL VALUE CHAINS FOR LIVESTOCK & CROPS; UNDERSTANDING AND IMPROVING FINANCIAL MARKETS AND DIGITAL SERVICES IN MULTIPLE COUNTRIES; UNDERSTANDING AND DEVELOPMENT OF PATHWAYS TO ACCELERATE PROGRESS FOR WOMEN AND GIRLS; STRATEGIC PROJECT MANAGEMENT; STRATEGY SUPPORT; EVALUATION, COMMUNICATION AND ADVOCACY SUPPORT.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description4Txt: GLOBAL POLICY & ADVOCACY - ACTIVITIES TO CULTIVATE NEW STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS AND TO ENCOURAGE INCREASED PRIVATE FUNDING FOR GLOBAL HEALTH AND GLOBAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE US AND ABROAD; ACCELERATE PROGRESS TOWARDS SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT GOALS; CONVENE GRANTEES TO PROMOTE COLLABORATION, IMPROVE PROGRAMS & STRENGTHEN THE GRANTEE NETWORK; SUPPORT GRANTEES IN DEVELOPING IMPACTFUL ADVOCACY AND COMMUNICATION STRATEGIES.

SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description1Txt: LUMIRADX LIMITED - A DIRECT EQUITY PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT AND COMMERCIALIZATION OF, AND TO SECURE GLOBAL ACCESS TO, AN INTEGRATED POINT-OF-CARE DIAGNOSTIC PLATFORM.
SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description2Txt: BUTTERFLY NETWORK, INC. - A DIRECT EQUITY PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO DEVELOP PROTOTYPES OF LOW-AND MIDDLE-INCOME COUNTRIES APPROPRIATE ULTRASOUND FOR A HEALTH CARE WORKER TO USE DURING ANTENATAL VISITS TO IDENTIFY HIGH RISK PREGNANCIES.

ExpenditureResponsibilityGrp.ResultsOfVerificationTxt: IN 2018, THE FOUNDATION CONDUCTED AN ASSURANCE REVIEW AND DETERMINED THAT A PORTION OF THE GRANT FUNDS WERE DIVERTED. THE FOUNDATION TOOK ALL REASONABLE AND APPROPRIATE STEPS TO INSURE THE RETURN OF THE DIVERTED FUNDS AND THE DEDICATION OF THE REMAINING GRANT FUNDS TO THE PURPOSES OF THE FUNDED PROJECT, INCLUDING REQUIRING THE GRANTEE TO: (1) RETURN THE DIVERTED FUNDS TO THE FOUNDATION, (2) PROVIDE ASSURANCES THAT FUTURE DIVERSIONS WOULD NOT OCCUR; AND (3) IMPLEMENT REVISED INTERNAL CONTROLS AND PRECAUTIONS TO PREVENT FUTURE DIVERSIONS FROM OCCURRING.

IN MAKING THIS GRANT, THE FOUNDATION CONFIRMED THE GRANTEE RESTORED PREVIOUSLY DIVERTED FUNDS, RECEIVED ASSURANCES FROM THE GRANTEE THAT FUTURE DIVERSIONS WILL NOT OCCUR, AND REQUIRED THE GRANTEE TO TAKE EXTRAORDINARY PRECAUTIONS TO PREVENT FUTURE DIVERSIONS.

ExplnOfNonFilingWithAGStmt.ExplanationTxt: THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA DOES NOT REQUIRE A COPY OF THE 990-PF. A COPY IS FILED WITH THE WASHINGTON SECRETARY OF STATE. CALIFORNIA DOES NOT REQUIRE A COPY OF THE FORM 990-PF IF THE FOUNDATION COMPLETES FORM 199, PART II. THIS SECTION OF FORM 199 WAS COMPLETED, THEREFORE NO FORM 990-PF IS REQUIRED TO BE FILED WITH THE STATE. MARYLAND DOES NOT REQUIRE A COPY OF THE FORM 990-PF TO BE SENT TO THE ATTORNEY GENERAL.
